caption_original:
Happy New Year!!!
We are starting 2016 with great news: as a first step towards celebrating Canada's 150th Anniversary of Confederation at Parks Canada places, our 2016 Discovery Pass will be valid for 24 months!

The Discovery Pass gives you unlimited opportunities to enjoy nearly 200 National Parks, National Historic Sites and National Marine Conservation Areas across Canada. Find out more: http://ow.ly/WgNJc

caption_original:
This coming Monday is the most exciting day of the year at Elk Island National Park - the start of Plains Bison handling.

Over three hundred bison will be weighed, aged, tagged and we’ll sample blood, hair and stool... it’s even more fun than it sounds! 

Here are some pictures from last year’s Wood Bison Handling: http://ow.ly/X6OLt

caption_original:
Have you ever tried snowshoeing? 

Here are 8 reasons why you should:
1) No or very little coordination is required. It’s simple to learn for all ages!
2) Little preparation time needed before leaving on a hike.
3) There’s low risk of injury and it’s easy on joints.
4) It’s a superior calorie-burner - about 500/hour.
5) It provides a great legs and buttocks workout - and arms too, if you add poles.
6) You can explore out-of-the-way places.
7) Snowshoeing is inexpensive - especially compared with other winter sports.
8) It's so much fun!!!
caption_cleaned: Have you ever tried snowshoeing? Here are reasons why you should: ) No or very little coordination is required. It’s simple to learn for all ages! ) Little preparation time needed before leaving on a hike. ) There’s low risk of injury and it’s easy on joints. ) It’s a superior calorie-burner - about /hour. ) It provides a great legs and buttocks workout - and arms too, if you add poles. ) You can elore out-of-the-way places. ) Snowshoeing is ineensive - especially compared with other winter sports. ) It's so much fun!!!

caption_original:
2015 is already behind us! These images recall the best underwater archaeology moments of the year at Parks Canada: a marine biology pilot project, a mission under the Arctic ice, including a video guided tour of the wreck of HMS Erebus, and dozens of artefacts to analyse.

caption_original:
Happy Camcorder Day!

Perhaps you're a professional who enjoys shooting the beauty of nature, or an extreme sports fan who attaches a GoPro to their helmet before going down the slopes. Or maybe you just like recording memories that can be cherished forever!

Either way, get out there and get filming... we want to see your best nature shots!

Perhaps you're a professional who enjoys shooting the beauty of nature, or an extreme sports fan who attaches a GoPro to their helmet before going down the slopes.
